subject: AI & Agents
title: Reproducibility: Same Input, Same Output
description: A micro-lesson that makes Reproducibility: Same Input, Same Output usable.

hook.text: You retrain the same model on the same data and get different results. Why?

buildup.text: Reproducibility requires fixing: random seeds, library versions, hardware, and data order.

discovery.text: Pin dependency versions, version datasets, and log the exact commit hash for every run.

twist.text: GPU non-determinism (floating point order) can cause small differences even with fixed seeds.

climax.text: Docker + DVC + Git + experiment tracking = reproducible ML. Use all four.

punchline.text: If you can't reproduce it, you can't trust it.

quiz.question: Why can GPU training produce different results with the same seed?
options: Floating point operation order varies on GPUs
